definition: announce the items on a (theatrical) program
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: What should the advertiser have said and what did he actually say instead?
sentences.chinese: 报幕员本应该说什么，最后却说成了什么？

sentences.english: The man yelled out his name and told him to leave him alone.
sentences.chinese: 于是那人大声喊着报幕员儿子的名字，让他别管他。

sentences.english: A young lady in my choir in her early 30s and I were the anchors in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 我和一位合唱团的三十来岁的女孩是当天晚上的报幕。

sentences.english: That was because the announcer's son, only 17 years old.
sentences.chinese: 因为马戏团报幕员的儿子只有17岁。

definition: to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
vocal accompaniment/to accompany a singer/to support of sb/to echo sb/to chime in with sb
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
to direct a television or radio broadcast/director (TV, radio)
sung performance/to sing for an audience
